title: Baby Boomer Milestones
description: From postwar optimism to cultural revolutions, how well do you remember the milestones that shaped a generation?

questions.question: The Baby Boom generation is generally defined as people born between which years?
What postwar housing development on Long Island became a symbol of suburban growth?
What childhood vaccine was widely distributed in the 1950s, often given on sugar cubes?
Which act signed in 1964 outlawed discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin?
What was the name of the first satellite launched into space by the Soviet Union in 1957?
Which 1960s gathering became known as the defining moment of the counterculture movement?
What was the first program broadcast in color on a regular basis by NBC?
options: Walt Disney's Wonderful World of Color

questions.question: In what year did the Beatles first appear on The Ed Sullivan Show?
What was the name of the birth control pill approved by the FDA in 1960?
What 1963 book by Betty Friedan is credited with sparking the second wave of feminism?
Which interstate highway system, signed into law in 1956, transformed American travel?
What 1950s craze had children spinning plastic rings around their waists?
Which event in 1969, besides the Moon landing, became synonymous with the hippie movement?
What was the first U.S. shopping mall to be fully enclosed, opening in 1956?
What 1970s event caused long gas station lines and fuel rationing across America?
